Posts.Content: Hi x baby wipes -non perfumed - they are great for freshening up as you will have to avoid any kind of perfumes near your arm or breast. I used them fir weeks after my Mx and lymph clearance they are perfect. Johnsons is recommended as best, just been for my 1st radiotherapy and I'm back to those again :-) A little cushion to put under your underarm to keep it supported is ideal as it will ache and you will feel very insecure for a couple of days. It also helps with relaxing as you'll find it stops you being so tense. V shaped pillow also helps when you home for sleeping as you won't be able to lie on your side for awhile. Good luck Hun xx
Posts.Title: What to take with me into hospital for MX & Lymph node clearance ...

Posts.Content: Well I'm now in the waiting list for my reconstruction. One expander out and implant in and other implant and lift to match. Can't believe it's nearly here! By nearly I mean it could be in next 6 months but apparently usually uts 2/3 months. Wud go in tomorrow if they let me. Scan on breasts in Thursday, closure scan as 6 months since MRI at a different hospital to check out left breast aswell. Hopefully still fine then that's it till op!! Still so strange. Good luck to all we will get there xx
Posts.Title: After Club and Beyond

Posts.Content: You will sue. Looking back it's like a strange dream. Thank you for your kind words as sometimes uts hard to post things about this stage as I am well aware of newbues like yourself who are starting out. But there is an end to it and it's a strange scary but kinda wonderful place to be :-). Mistymoley so pleased you are here too. I too have a holiday booked and hope my op doesn't coincide lol x strange when my main worry is what to buy to wear for a wedding that suits a skinhead hairdo! And not next chemo or radio. Back to work too and it's as if I've never been away. My boyfriend keeps saying how proud he is and what I've been through is massive and I think now I'm off the treadmill of treatment I need to acknowledge that and rejoice. It's just very strange :-) but wish everyone was posting the same xxx
Posts.Title: After Club and Beyond

Posts.Content: Hi all I've a lot of scarves that I've ordered over the last few months n being honest don't wear half of them Has anyone found websites for evening scarves that actually are trendy n comfy? And day ones that are funky but don't scream cancer? Or break the bank! My wig hurts so I can't wear it, well think it's ruined now! And as the weather is improving and my chemo finished I would love now to get out more. Cheers all xx
Posts.Title: Scarves headwear day n night

Posts.Content: Thanx guys - all appreciated. Sick of looking lime I'm in mourning !! Looks like shopping for me :-) xx
Posts.Title: Scarves headwear day n night

Posts.Content: Hi I'm new to this so here goes.I'm having a really rough time with the second part of my FecT ( the T part obv :-) ) wondered if anyone found any ways to get through it. ?? Thanks for any help xx
Posts.Title: FecT-T part and it's side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Sue Think I'm just reaching out for help and to know that it's not just me feeling crap. Didn't realise I could speak to breast care nurse bout treatment but oncologist assistant just says it's 'normal' Got the mouth ulcers, can't taste anything. Sore fingers toes. Poorly for at least 6 days.ache all over with muscle twinging etc and feel totally out of it if honest Just got the lot I think. Always thought this part would be the easy part. Really not looking forward to next one :-( I'll defo get the mouthwash Thank you xx
Posts.Title: FecT-T part and it's side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Libby Thank u for your reply. I've got most of the side effects from Fec with mouth etc but it's the muscle pain, finger ends and toes, and the feeling if being totally exhausted and well quite out of it really My next one is Feb 14th and will try tramadol as that's been recommended for next time. But that makes me quite spacy but I'm gonna give it a go xx
Posts.Title: FecT-T part and it's side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks Jen I agree. If is bad it's doing good. My tumours were removed before chemo - I had two types and they are reasonably happy that they got it all so chemo is follow up only then radiotherapy then hopefully that's it. Seems like it will never end but hey one more to go Thanks for your message -wish I had joined this earlier as haven't had anyone to talk to on all this. It would have really helped xx
Posts.Title: FecT-T part and it's side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks lulu I'll try there. Adele I've got loads from annabandana they're really good value xx
Posts.Title: Scarves headwear day n night

Posts.Content: Thanks Fiona In all honesty been on this site bout an hour and I feel so much better knowing I'm not alone doing all this. Cheers xx
Posts.Title: FecT-T part and it's side effects

Posts.Content: Hi senga, I've just had day 4 of radiotherapy and can honestly say it's nothing. I have a temporary expander in my right breast after mx so I was expecting discomfort or something but so far so good. Obviously I have another 11 to go but you don't feel a thing when it's being done. The travelling back and forth is a pain, unless it happens to be near u? There may be issues ahead but nothing compared with what I've already been through and you will have too. In all honesty, and I hate to sound flip, it's boring!! Hope it's just as boring for you too :-) it will all be explained in your induction then after that it take ten mins tops. Oh and take a book just incase they are running late etc moisturise with cream and rear as hopefully this is the last step of a long journey xx
Posts.Title: starting radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Been on here so many times and tried to post and I don't know why but I couldn't. Guilty perhaps that my journey was finished while so many others are starting theirs. Or maybe for selfish reasons just plainly wanting to turn my back on the big C. Snub him. Show him he's not important anymore or just plainly blocking it all out. Maybe all of them. It's now a year since diagnosis for me in few days. What a year. Mastectomy auxiliary clearance chemotherapy radiotherapy then the crawl back to 'normal!?' I guess what I'm here to say is I feel GREAT :-) it was rough after it all ending so anti depressants were necessary for me and it took a while to accept that and ladies they helped so much. My life now is better than before. I know how important life is and I'm living it. Been to Finland, back out with the girls, back to work full time even doing overtime lol and just came back from rocking it at V. I still come on here and check you all out especially those that helped me get through this with kind words and support. Lifes there ladies just waiting for u and u will get there. And when u do accept if u need help then LIVE. Lots love to you all. Stay strong xxx Janice xxxx
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Mine have stopped too Libby and don't think I have done anything ...!
Posts.Title: Site Notifications of New Posts

Posts.Content: Thank u both for replying As usual I cried when reading it. I know I need to do something so have just made an appointment with my GP for Wednesday morning. Not that brave of me as need a prescription for couple of side effects but hopefully when I get in I'll be able to talk. I'm just so aware of how busy everyone is gp's, chemo nurses etc. Now one of the side effects night delay my final dose of T - if that happens I really dont think I will be able to hide how I feel anymore anyway. I know it's time to stop hiding how I feel so hopefully I will Thanks
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: You definetly are - go for it I'm going to ask bout it - wish had asked sooner x
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: Thanks adele Everyone expects me to be happy that it's my last chemo and I am. But I look in the mirror and hate hate hate wat I see. Maybe if that side of things hurried up then I wouldn't feel so bad but I'm not that vain so I know it's how I feel inside too. I feel this cancer has took everything from me and I have no control over my own body. I can't hurry things and honestly would love nothing more than my eyelashes back. My wigs awful n gives me headache, weight gain is ridiculous no matter wat I do. My body just seems so alien to me. Funny but my expander being bigger than my normal breast dusnt bother me that much. Strange!!! I need to get a grip for my kids, my 17 yr old daughter has been through so much with me, she dusnt deserve more grief. But ive managed to hold it together so far but the cracks are beginning to show My recent words to her of looking like Voldemar with boobs cracked her up ! But I feel so ugly And that's why I'm gonna do sumthing. I just hope my gp makes it easy for me. I'm not one to open up easily. Writing this is hard. So sick of moaning now - sorry Xx
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: Hi Gail Sorry to hear you joining the ranks. I didn't have to make a decision as the size of my tumours,lobular and ductal, were too large so had to go straight for a mastectomy. I just wanted to say that I am so pleased I had my reconstruction and mastectomy. I have had few issues with it and still have my nipple etc so feel still womanly. I know several people who have had lumpectomies and had loads of issues with infections,scars etc One of my cancers is common to be found in both breasts and I was disappointed they wudnt let me have a double mastectomy but it's against policy as it was clear. Just going through FecT now - only one more to go thank goodness. I hope u make the right decision for you and good luck xx Janice
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy or double masectomy

Posts.Content: What can I say ... I thought it was just me I'm 47 had mastectomy after diagnosis last September. My last Tax tomorrow and I've never felt so low in my life. I've been so strong throughout just feel like I'll never find me again. I've shut off family and friends as can't cope now with how I look n feel.I know it needs to stop but I just don't know how. My family think I'm fine n busy. My friends I cancel on all the time or pretend I'm having a bad day or busy. I can't talk to anyone as I know I'll just cry. And I don't think I'd stop. Knowing it's not just me helps. I've posted here before but not the truth of how I'm feeling. The people I could talk to have so much going on in their lives I don't want to add to them. I prob won't even post this .....
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: That's brill adele xx I've just organised a nite at friends and told others I need their help n it's been fab. They just want help. I'm so glad I opened up on here. Feeling so much better :-) Here's to the future xx
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: Hi to all who posted on this discussion. Chrissie adele Everyone Just wanted to say a big thank u as I have took my first steps back to me and it feels good. Think on here I just admitted at last how I felt and gave into it and I think it needed to be done. But nows time to fight back :-) Made my gp appt and she was great. No meds but she says see how I go. I'm now sorting all the things I cudnt face, wigs, eyelashes lol , money situation but mostly things that will make me feel better. Going to a friends which I have refused up till now and generally getting back to life but slowly. I'm still bit wary. But if feels good. It's not gonna win. Chemos over, dates for radio booked in. Time to move on. It does get better ;-) just gotta be more open n admit those bad days, when a release is needed, but back on the horse as soon as yr last tear cried. Lifes there waiting and it's far too precious to waste Thank u all :-)
Posts.Title: So close to the end of treatment yet finding it so hard

Posts.Content: Ladies I can say that my breast shape, well that of the expander inside, has changed slightly, a little mishapen and convoluted to the touch and has hardened a bit. And my permanent implants won't be put in till at least another 6 months - well I'll know more in may- so it's not too concerning. My surgeon was going to put in permanent implants but decided against it due to the RT. Is there no way you could have temp expanders like me? Or am I missing something. It would mean surgery twice but a gap of at least 6 months where you might be in a lot better position. Thoughts with u xx
Posts.Title: Immediate reconstruction followed by radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi tinkers. I had immediate reconstruction (temporary expander) after my lymph node clearance, which was 2 weeks after my mastectomy. I didn't have radiotherapy straightaway as I had chemo but the chemo did affect my breast and arm, tiny bit swelling and exercises started up again to avoid cording. Finished my chemo feb 14th and then RT started on march 17th. I have just 2 days left on RT. I can honestly say the RT hasn't been an issue at all except again a little bit sore, just round my scar and again small restrictions in movement but exercises help. It's tiring only in the travelling and probably mentally as I know it's coming to the end. Dunno if this helps you but if I hadn't had chemo I think I would have been fine going straight to RT. Obviously it's a different op and we are all different. Hope you get it sorted xx
Posts.Title: Immediate reconstruction followed by radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Hun. I have no idea what Becker 35 implants are but I have a temporary expander in my right breast and it's filled with approx 510ml of saline, think that's what's in now lol, fitted on the 20th sept 2011, and flew on october 12th with no issues at all. Had only had my auxiliary clearance on the 4th too. My surgeon said would be fine and he was right. Check with yours if you not sure but honestly didn't have a twinge tho did worry bout it before I went xx
Posts.Title: Implants and flying

Posts.Content: Hi Can anyone tell me,probably those who have been through all their treatment, why I would need a ultrasound scan only 6/7 weeks after radiotherapy finished. Got the appointment on Friday lunchtime and then went to an 'end of treatment' session with other ladies and our BC nurses My BCN was telling everyone it would be a year before we would be checked. She was totally baffled as to why i would have an appointment and asked to see it She is going to look into it and get back to me but that won't be till at least tuesday. Have to say I'm worried. Only saw my oncologist once during RT and was just a formality but now I'm wondering if something has shown on scans before RT or what. I'm not due to see her till July. Any ideas ladies? Bit scary to be honest. Xx
Posts.Title: Follow up scans/mammograms post treatment!

Posts.Content: Hi all Just wanted to say I've just finished my 3rd and last tax. My 1st was horrendous with all side effects u have named. I too spent nights on the sofa unable to rest for the pains, mouth jawbone legs head etc etc I was advised to use tramadol and on my 2nd dose I was a lot better tho the flu like symptoms were awful. But suprisingly my third has been ok, I coped really well and found that all the side effects were dramatically reduced and just the tiredness remains. Hope this is the same for u, I know it's different for everyone. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi shelley and Wendy. Glad to see u back Wendy :-). Shelley it will take a little time. Like Wendy I had the temporary expander put in. It took about 4 weeks to settle but does get better. Just don't overdue it. You shouldnt be ironing hoovering etc for at least 6 weeks Ironing used to really set mine off so then I would have to rest my arm for a couple of days. Any use of your arm affects your breast muscles and that's your issue. It is hard but worth it. The tumours are out and that has to be a good thing. I have to tske care all the Time with lifting etc and mine was back in sept 2011 I'm having a little trouble with mine now due to RT but I know it will settle. I too will watch with interest for replies. But I'm assured by my BCN this is normal. Xx
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Poor u. Hope u ok now. It's only when I read some of the posts in here I realise my journey hasn't been too bad at all. But it's always easy to say that when it's been done. When's your next Tax? One of the things that really helped on my third was to eat. As soon as I started feeling yuck my fella fed me lol. And I have to say it worked. Even though most of the time I couldn't taste much, even if it was just a slice of toast n jam. I think he's a feeder really bless him, but I'll get help for him later haha It's the only time. 3rd Tax.that he was with me so I can honestly say it must have helped. So graze if u can, little and often. I even slept better. It's great when it's all done and I was on a real high though long journey yet. Good luck and keep us informed of how it goes xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish and Suzie Lost you guys so just found you. Fab news Suzie it's such a relief isn't it x I sat in a daze for a cuple of days couldnt get it to sink in. Gets even better after all side effects are over :-) trash it will not be long for you too. Was laughing at your Eye issues lol I have painted my eyeballs so much I'm suprised they arent grey. It's quite difficult and I'm still waiting, last tax feb 14th, for the party um going to have when my prodigal eyelashes return !! Miss them sooooo much. As for hair ! It's absurd ! Why Did I have to weekly get my eyebrows done before C and now they won't grow.hair on my heads grown but the grey/dark curly/straight, long/short sparse in areas look isn't in Vogue from what I can see !! Still least it's growing :-) on day 11 of radiotherapy and it's a breeze. Bit uncomfy today as expanders tightening a bit but that's it.not a problem except the long journey daily to have it done. Seems a bit of an anticlimax after all we've been through. Back to work in 3 weeks on a two hour day phased return. Can it be that life is getting back to pre last September. Guess what Is bugging me now is that I don't want to look like a cancer victim now, so guess it's wig time. Not keen as the tension headaches were awful but the looks you get, and we've all had them and worse!! Are what i find hard to cope with now. Enuf is enuf. Time to get back on the horse ! Hope radio is as easy for you Suzie and look forward to your post Trish when you are done with yucky chemo. :-) keep safe and smiling lots hugs xx Oh and day two of tamoxifen ! Should be fun. More hot sweats !!! I'll melt away. There'll just be a puddle where I stood lol x
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Trish That's fab news. I'm so pleased. I hope the next one is even easier like mine was. My nails are awful to look at. Each one is 3/4 a horrid dead yellow colour but they are still holding on there for dear life. My last Tax was on the 14th so I'm hoping I'll be able to just keep trimming them till the good bit prevail. Just wish my eyelashes would come home :-( Good luck with your last one please let us know :-) Bring on the radiotherapy - hopefully will be a after chemo xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Hi suzie Poor you. Sorry to hear that, just another side effect you can do without. I've tried to contact a friend of a friend with no luck as I know she had the same issue. When I hear I'll update you. I know of a couple of people who had a reduced dosage, one had extra session added. It's normal practice but I would call your chemo unit and ask your questions or u will just worry and that will do u no good. Sorry I can't help on this but I know there are some medical people on this forum so start a new thread and ask the question Hun. Keep us updated. I'm just resting, well trying to get fit n failing!! Radiotherapy starts in march then lead up back to work. If I can ever sort the way I look :-( Waiting very very impatiently for the return home of my eyelashes. Sick of looking like an alien lol Hope u get an answer quick xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects

Posts.Content: Shelly it does get better honest. Mistymoleys right they do soften and it's just a case of getting used to them. Mine was just settling round the nipple when Radiotherapy had to done. Though every chemo did set it off a little too. But I'm just careful what i do with my arm, though real life is real life and as a single mum things need to get done lol, so if I overdue it I know about it. Not pain just uncomfortable. RT has rippled mine and I look forward to my implants whenever that may be. You will know wen u are ready to do things, driving etc. You get to know what you can get away with and what you can't. My boobs are now on two different equators, can't wait to have them match !! Take it easy it was quite an op and you have double the issues bless you xxx
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy immediate reconstruction with implants please h...

Posts.Content: Hi lynne I had my first fec on the 1.1.2011 and I too lost chunks of my hair within ten days and as was quite thick I managed to get to next dose but that was as long as I could keep it. It was so painful when I had the hair after fec, felt like every follicle was complaining ! Also my head was so cold after I shaved it that I had to use bed hats they are quite sweet. I was offered cold cap but was lead to believe that the chemo would not work where the cold cap was as this means that cancer cells could grow there - I just said no thanks I too got a wig but haven't worn it and just use scarves and coped well till I lost my eyelashes then went into meltdown but falsies on and coping better :-) Ready to start with wig now as bored with scarves - ready to start getting back to normal. It's tuff some days but there's always sumo e here who totally understands Take care n good luck
Posts.Title: hair loss

Posts.Content: Mite be worth a ring Wendy as my surgeon doesn't like anyone going home unless the drain was 30/40 ml and to lower the risk of infection they weren't keen on breast care patients to go home with drain, seems to differ by area. I was in hospital both times for 5 days. Didn't mind tho as the rest was nice xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi jan x I had lobular cancer, common in both breasts,in my right breast as well as ductal. I pushed with my surgeon, though just slightly as no need for anything else, to have my left breast checked out, as there was changes noted on my original checks before diagnosis. Just breast changes but I was concerned. They sorted an MRI and thankfully was clear though I'd still love a mastectomy in my left too, but they won't carry it out in healthy breasts. Something I intend to try and take further. A couple of weeks isn't going to make any difference but for peace of mind speak to your BCN and stress you need it done. Peace of mind is necessary as much as possible in the fight we face xx
Posts.Title: healthy breast????

Posts.Content: Hi Trish just saw your post about post Taxotere abdominal distention! Mine was everywhere. When was your last Tax? Mine was feb 14th and I'm on day 3 of rads. Fluid is now going down whoopee ! Felt like a sumo wrestler :-( Wendy I've sent u a PM - hope it makes sense as it was early and had had no sleep with this lousy headcold :-( Xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Thinking of you today Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, hope ok to butt in. My hospital only gave me gown for operation then it was up to me but Make sure your pyjamas have baggy sleeves that way you will be more comfy if u have a drain in or the docs need to see stitching etc. Primark was great as I threw them all away after. Any tops that ate easy to get on and off without any effort. A small cushion for under your arm is brill fir sleep, relaxing or just generally to feel comfy. My hospital BC gave me a Hug in a Bag and it was filled with allsorts from a BC pen to hand cream and the vest thing was a hand made heart shaped small cushion which was for under my arm. Bliss ! Honestly really helps. Music a must as u will be too tired to read. I agree anything to freshen your mouth - fruit sweets, mints, biscuits if u feel bit sickly. Hope goes well xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy x don't think it has to be heart shaped although it was perfect. Mine was handmade by a group here in Sunderland that donate them to the breast cancer patients. Just small enough to fit under yr arm.I would send it to you if we have time before your op. I don't mind. If you want to private message me your address ? Honestly be no prob. I didn't take my V shaped pillow in as the beds were fab, and had tons pillows just put two in the shape of your V pillow and one horizontal accross and you should be fine tho couple of patients had their own pillow things. I was the only breast patient the first time so learnt by my mistakes lol x Do take your make up in if you want as you will be surprised at how you can and need to move your arm. Think of it as exercise lol x Again let me know about the little pillow, be nice to help xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda. Sorry you are here on this site but please read your post again. You will see how you are going to get through this. Your post reads from someone who has accepted, in a way as we never really accept it all, and are working out in your mind how to play it, to the least effect on your family. That's the first stage for most of us women on these paths. And it's this attitude of love and caring for family that will get you through. I too was horrified at my diagnosis, so scared for my kids, as a single mum although they are 17 and 22. Thought how on earth do I get through it - well it's a ride you get on and you can't get off till it's done. And you will find strength, we all do. I'm now through mastectomy, lymph node clearance, chemo and radio and I'm not brave. Just has to be done. It went by so quickly in hindsight and there are times when you feel low but you get up and get on with it im now on a 2 week break before back to work, was diagnosed in sept 2011. Feels like yesterday. Yes looking back there are things I would have done differently but none was about treatment, just throw everything at me was my request. You sound like you have a strong family and that will help soo much. I wish I'd had that. Hide your bad days from your children if you need too but share them with someone, you need support as well as you supporting your family. You can do this. I did it. :-) xx take care and we are all with you xx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: You just shout when you need us. That's what this is all about. I think you are right about not accepting it, I still now after treatment can't quite believe I have the c word. If I say it out loud to someone I find it so peculiar like it's not real. Once you know what you are facing and treatment starts then in a way it's easier, well not easier but you can organise your battle plan. I still remember how scared I was. All I thought about was my kids and how I couldn't not be there for them. I'm recently divorced and they don't have a great support network. My son through treatment didn't say much but when he did it was to the point. When feeling ill with chemo his response was ' well at least you know it's working !' and he was right. My daughter has been fab, my son lives with his flatmate but my daughter was stuk with me,she was there with the scarves false eyelashes and the typical needs of a 17 yr old that got me through lol ! You have to do this for them. Many many women have the chemo first to shrink it, I had 2 types lobular and ductal and no option but mastectomy, everyones different. It's not an easy road, but one that people get through over and over again. And this site will support you when you want to question, scream, rant, rejoice and anything else you feel. Speak soon xxx
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Hi Check out my post named Travel Insurance posted on 4/3/2012 for ideas on who to go with. There were some good yearly offers from Avante and AllClear for me. Cancer in lymph nodes had chemo and by time I purchase it will have done radio too. Was really pleased with it. You will only be able to do one journey but fingers crossed you will get a good deal xx enjoy as lifes for living :-) xx
Posts.Title: Easyjet plane travel - will there be a problem?

Posts.Content: Hi I travelled two weeks after my mastectomy and node clearance and before chemo started and had no issues with easyjet. Mainly because it never came up. I couldn't get travel insurance though due to leaving the decision to go till the day before. I agree with all it's your travel insurance that will be the issue x have great time xx
Posts.Title: Easyjet plane travel - will there be a problem?

Posts.Content: Hi traceydee I just had my 5th chemo couple weeks ago and my 6th and thank god Final is on feb 14th !! All I can advise is if it is the T part of FecT then make sure you have pain relief set in place just in case - see older posts on here - there are a few good points and may help u. Just don't suffer in silence like I did. It's not a punishment tho it feels like it! Get help cos we all need it xx You getting there keep remembering that xx
Posts.Title: 4th chemo to day

Posts.Content: Tracey I get the same problem with bloods - well they've never been low but took them an hour and ten mins to get bloods. They keep to same arm tho. I tip I picked up is to keep very warm before they try. I layer up n thick socks on etc n drink lots fluids and it really helped honestly. It was becoming a nightmare. Now I'm so less stressed wen I go and the last time was no bother at all. I'll be getting radio but have no idea how many. Think I'll be told next week wen I see my oncologist. I've got scans today on my kidneys etc so worried. It's because of repeated water infections. It's never just the cancer it's all the side effects too. Still could be worse :-) Keep warm Hun n it'll be good xx
Posts.Title: 4th chemo to day

Posts.Content: Why can't doctors carrying out scans just say if it's ok or not!! Post treatment and had a scan. Don't really know why but BCN checked and said it was 6 month review from MRI I had to check out left breast as cancer type usually in both. Ok ! I understand that. So why did she, a foreign elderly dr who I have had before and she was the same then! Asked me what the problem was !?! I don't know. U asked me to come in! Then she read reports ignored totally my left 'normal'' breast and concentrated on the area under my right armpit and down the side of my expander !?! She never said a word even though I asked a couple of questions. Then took my prints and left the room stating she needed to check other results!! And never came back?!! The young nurse had to go and ask her if I could go home!?! How ignorant! I was told to go home and now left baffled as to what that was all about !!! Some bedside manner !! Well going to ignore such rudeness and have wine, great weekend with my lovely fella and our daughters doing race for life. Cos we are in this to win :-) xxx
Posts.Title: How ignorant and rude !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda I had my expander fitted in October, after removal of lobular and ductal. It was uncomfortable for a while and even now I have an aversion to touching the magnet. But the 'pressure' I felt with it has greatly eased and been fine till chemo. After every chemo session it is uncomfortable and tender but this wears of with the other side effects. However I have my 3rd and last dose of Tax next week and I am still uncomfortable and pained from last dose. Also if I carry something heavy or overdue using my arm then I know I'll have a few days of 'issues' with it. I'm lucky not too have any fluid so msybe as previously said that's the issue. I am still so pleased it's there but it is weird to say the least. So convoluted, strange to touch etc Hope it settles down or u get sorted real soon Good luck Janice xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had expander problems ?

Posts.Content: Hi ladies. I'm finished all my chemo and RT so I'm at the other end of the journey. I had issues with losing my hair, as I had long hair, but in the end it was a relief as it actually hurt. Your hair follicles seem to be so tender so after 1st chemo off it went. I have used my wig twice and just stuck with scarves and am due back to work in a weeks time. I'll be happy with the bald look as it looks really edgy and to be honest my wig is a fright! I wish I had taken more time to get if right but too late. So take time and make sure you are comfortable with it as it will help greatly. As for eyelashes :-( I was unlucky and lost them all though not everyone does. I'm still in mourning but have used false ones lots of times. I just put them ine higher than my lash line and fill in under them with eyeliner. Works a treat :-). My last chemo was 14th feb so they are taking a while to come back but there is alternatives. I kept some eyebrows and basically joined the dots withan eyeliner and they are growing back. It's all a case of feeling as good as you can in this crappy path we have to take. But you do get out the other side just like me. Thoughts wit you ladies take care xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling Gutted

Posts.Content: Hi SC Never apologise about how u feel, none of it is very nice regardless of what treatment you need. I am about to start my radiotherapy after chemo and am a bit dubious bout what to expect. My first is on Saturday. I'm concerned as I have a temporary expander in after mx and it can cause issues. Still has to be done and then Tamoxifen. I live 223 miles away from my boyfriend and had only been with him for over a year, nearly two. Last thing we needed. My breast are totally different sizes shapes and not in the geographical area lol Joking aside I still find it hard to accept what it looks like but he has been amazing. Just try to talk and be honest about your insecurities. I'm still not great at it but luckily he's so supportive. I'm also bald and put on a stone after chemo and what upset me mist was losing my eyelashes ! It's a tough journey all round for all involved. You have a right to rant n give vent to your feelings. Thus is happening to our bodies and outside of our control and it's crap. But it's not forever and it will get better. You arent different just for a little while your body will be. Talk to someone if you need to. Councelling etc just don't bottle it up. I did for a while and it's not a nice place to be. Think if it was other way round - would it change how u felt about your fella? Course not. Probably make you love him more. It's hard but you will get there. Hope radio goes well for you. Let me know. Chin up, head high and take care xx
Posts.Title: puckerred boob

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah can I ask was your implant a temporary one after your mastectomy? Or was it an actual implant? I've a temporary implant and due to start my radiotherapy and have concerns as to how it's going to pan out.
